intro: Ophiorrhiza annamica, commonly known as the Annamite orchid vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent calyx. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia. Ophiorrhiza annamica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests and along riverbanks.
